'''Leroy Maxey Drumm''' (September 26, 1936 â€“ November 26, 2010) was an [[Americans|American]] [[Bluegrass music|bluegrass]]/[[country music]] songwriter who served in the [[United States Navy]], in the 3rd Division as a sonar man aboard the {{USS|Soley}} (DD-707), an [[Allen M. Sumner class destroyer|''Allen M. Sumner''-class]] [[destroyer]] and deployed to the Mediterranean from July 1956 to February 1957.

Upon leaving the Navy, he worked as a general laborer and welder in and around [[Detroit]], [[Michigan]]. Leroy and Pete Goble co-wrote the song "Colleen Malone" recorded by [[Hot Rize]] on their ''[[Take It Home (Hot Rize album)|Take It Home]]'', that won the IBMA's Song of the Year award in 1991.
